item.title: Beogram 4002 Type 5513: Floating Chassis
item.description:
This short post will illustrate an intriguing difference in the suspension systems of two Beogram 4002 Type 5513 turntables. The first Beogram 4002 Type 5513, serial number 1312615, used a stack of concave washers to secure the floating suspension to the top plate. These washers were also present on the bottom lock. The second Beogram 4002 Type 5513, serial number 1311076, features a slightly different suspension mechanism. This earlier production model employs a single, concave metal piece between the suspension lock and the top plate...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-type-5513-floating-chassis/

item.title: Beogram 4002 Type 5513: Inside Work
item.description:
My work on restoring a Beogram 4002 turntable from Houston continues, focusing on the internal components this time. This update covers the refurbishment of the tangential arm assembly and the replacement of the Beogram’s reservoir capacitor. Here’s a current picture of the Beogram 4002 with its chassis and tangential arm assembly removed. The tangential arm assembly components on this Beogram 4002 are in great condition. My work mainly involved cleaning and lubricating the Beogram chassis parts...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-type-5513-inside-work/
